sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in alkali metals. K: Available from chemical suppliers or online retailers. Rb: Purchase from specialized chemical suppliers. Sb: Source from metal supply companies or online chemical retailers. Se: Obtain from chemical suppliers or online platforms.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supply company specializing in alkali metals. K: Available from chemical suppliers or online retailers. Rb: Purchase from specialized chemical suppliers. Sb: Source from metal supply companies or online chemical retailers. Se: Obtain from chemical suppliers or online platforms.

1. Weigh 27.8 g of Cs in a dry, inert environment. 2. Measure 6.2 g of K. 3. Weigh 15.4 g of Rb. 4. Measure 14.1 g of Sb. 5. Weigh 66.5 g of Se. 6. Combine all weighed ingredients in a clean, dry glass or ceramic crucible. 7. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula to ensure uniform distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh 27.8 g of Cs in a dry, inert environment. 2. Measure 6.2 g of K. 3. Weigh 15.4 g of Rb. 4. Measure 14.1 g of Sb. 5. Weigh 66.5 g of Se. 6. Combine all weighed ingredients in a clean, dry glass or ceramic crucible. 7. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula to ensure uniform distribution.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 800 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a furnace. 2. Heat the mixture to 800 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction of the materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cool, remove the solid from the crucible. 2. If necessary, grind the solid into a fine powder using a mortar and pestle. 3. Optionally, press the powder into a mold to achieve the desired dimensions (3 in x 2 in x 7 in). 4. Seal the final product in a suitable container to prevent moisture absorption.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cool, remove the solid from the crucible. 2. If necessary, grind the solid into a fine powder using a mortar and pestle. 3. Optionally, press the powder into a mold to achieve the desired dimensions (3 in x 2 in x 7 in). 4. Seal the final product in a suitable container to prevent moisture absorption.
